alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 2:21PM MST until January 29 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. Similar conditions are expected for the Wind Chill Watch Monday night. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 7 PM this evening to noon MST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
